alert.note: Alert for Central Panhandle Mountains; Northern Panhandle (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued October 25 at 11:04AM MDT until October 25 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...FIRST SNOW EVENT FOR THE INLAND NORTHWEST TODAY... .Significant mountain snow accumulation above 3000 feet and measurable snow for lower elevations below 2500 feet. A robust and cold weather system will deliver mountain snow, lowland rain-snow, and colder overnight temperatures lingering through the remainder of the week. Mountain passes will be impacted by the heavy snowfall and lowland areas may see impacts to trees and sensitive vegetation from wet snow accumulation. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM PDT THIS AFTERNOON ESPECIALLY ELEVATIONS ABOVE 3000 FEET... * WHAT...Snow Especially elevations above 3000 feet. Additional snow accumulations up to 3 inches above 3000 feet. Less than 2 inches below 3000 feet. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Kellogg, St. Maries, Sandpoint, Athol, Mullan, Eastport, Fernwood, Osburn, Clark Fork, Fourth Of July Pass, Wallace, Pinehurst, Bonners Ferry, Dobson Pass, Schweitzer Mountain Road, Lookout Pass, and Priest River. * WHEN...Until 5 PM PDT this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the Wednesday evening commute.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
